channel.title: Inception
channel.description:
Anyone seen it?
I thought it was a pretty epic movie. Great plot, soundtrack, and an ending which got me thinking a lot.

item.title: Inception
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I didn’t find it exhilarating or ‘that great’ as I had been lead to believe by the reviews and ratings. Worked out pretty much what was going on throughout the film.

Overall worth a watch, but I can’t say ill be watching it again anytime soon.

item.title: Inception
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:3, topic:349961”]Yeah, I constantly thought of Shutter Island after watching the movie.

What do you think about the ending…dream or reality?[/quote]I think it’s a dream and there will be a sequel. I think he was in the dream ever since he went into that place where he talked to the drug dude, and tested “The new stable drug”. Remember when he was about to spin the top and was washing his face? He never remembered to spin the top to make sure he was in reality, ya know?

Read full topic

item.title: Inception
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Man UTD Freak:

Just saw this movie last night after hearing great reviews from some friends and I have to point out at what an innovation this really was. I mean, unlike most movies, puzzle by puzzle was thrown at you every minute and it required so much thinking. Good on Chris Nolan that he didn’t leave an obvious ending, I believe that would have decreased the ratings of the movie. I have to admit that after I had watched the ending, I believed that it was the obvious ending but after reading some articles on the movie, I then realised that there was a twist in the tail. Throughout the duration of Inception, there were so many things to understand and after it had finished we had to discuss the whole movie together to fully make sense of it and even then we had trouble in doing just that. I guess it’s a necessity to watch it again.

read the link i gave, it is reality at the end

Read full topic

Good on Chris Nolan that he didn’t leave an obvious ending, I believe that would have decreased the ratings of the movie. item.title: Inception
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

yeah great film, at first I thought the ending was reality, but after thinking about the fact that the totem never stopped spinning and that his kids had not aged since his last memory of them, the fact that they were wearing the same clothes in the same spot etc etc makes me believe that its quite possible that he believes he is in reality when really he is in a dream, designed from memories. Whether this is limbo or not I am not sure, perhaps not limbo, I think the idea is that in limbo you do not know you are in limbo because you can’t remember what happened, with that in mind and the fact that the guy he was working for (forgot his name) reminded him, it is possible they got out of limbo but not completely out of the dream. Im not too sure, although I think there is more evidence for the ending to be a dream than reality, despite first thoughts.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:3, topic:349961”]Yeah, I constantly thought of Shutter Island after watching the movie.

What do you think about the ending…dream or reality?[/quote]To be honest, I was so focused on the assumed fact that it was all reality, I didn’t pay much attention to the possibility that it could have been a dream, which is why I have to watch it again with a new perspective.

item.title: Inception
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

I was going to make a thread about this just now.

It was very good, although a bit complex to comprehend at first. I found the movie to be a lot like Leonardo DiCaprio’s last movie, Shutter Island, with the tragedy concerning his wife and the double ending. I definitely have to see it one more time to get a more thorough grasp on the movie, since I feel I missed a few key components.

Read full topic
